member.name: T:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe
member.summary: Service used to check if a GitHub Enterprise instance lives at a given URL.

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue)
member.summary: Creates a new EnterpriseProbe, used to check for the existence of GitHub Enterprise Instances
member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue,Octokit.Internal.IHttpClient)
member.summary: Creates a new EnterpriseProbe, used to check for the existence of GitHub Enterprise Instances
member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.
The client to use for executing requests

member.name: M:Octokit.EnterpriseProbe.Probe(System.Uri)
member.summary: Makes a request to the specified URL and returns whether or not the probe could definitively determine that a GitHub Enterprise Instance exists at the specified URL.
member.remarks: The probe checks the absolute path /site/sha at the specified .
member.returns: An with either , , or in the case the request failed

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.Ok
member.summary: Yep! It's an Enterprise server

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.NotFound
member.summary: Got a response from a server, but it wasn't an Enterprise server

member.name: F:Octokit.EnterpriseProbeResult.Failed
member.summary: Request timed out or DNS failed. So it's probably the case it's not an enterprise server but we can't know for sure.

member.name: T:Octokit.IOauthClient
member.summary: Provides methods used in the OAuth web flow.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.GetGitHubLoginUrl(Octokit.OauthLoginRequest)
member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states don’t match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: T:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient
member.summary: A client for GitHub's Organization Members API.
member.remarks: See the Orgs API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.OauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states don’t match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: M:Octokit.OrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.summary: Gets a reference for a given repository by reference name

The reference parameter supports either the fully-qualified ref (prefixed with "refs/", e.g. "refs/heads/master" or "refs/tags/release-1") or the shortened form (omitting "refs/", e.g. "heads/master" or "tags/release-1")

member.name: T:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException
member.summary: Exception thrown when GitHub API Rate limits are exceeded.

summary.para: For requests using Basic Authentication or OAuth, you can make up to 5,000 requests per hour. For unauthenticated requests, the rate limit allows you to make up to 60 requests per hour.
See http://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting for more details.

member.summary: The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per hour.

member.summary: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

member.summary: The date and time at which the current rate limit window resets

member.name: M:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.GetRetryAfterTimeSpan
member.summary: Calculates the time from now to wait until the next request can be attempted.
member.returns: A non-negative value. Returns if the next Rate Limit window has started and the next request can be attempted immediately.
member.remarks: The return value is calculated using server time data from the response in order to provide a best-effort estimate that is independent from eventual inaccuracies in the client's clock.

member.summary: Create a new instance of the GitHub API v3 client pointing to https://api.github.com/

member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.

member.name: M:Octokit.ApiExtensions.IsTrue(Octokit.IResponse)
member.summary: Returns true if the API call represents a true response, or false if it represents a false response. Throws an exception if the HTTP status does not match either a true or false response.
member.remarks: Some API endpoints return a 204 for "true" and 404 for false. See https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/starring/#check-if-you-are-starring-a-repository for one example. This encapsulates that logic.
member.exception: Thrown if the status is neither 204 nor 404
member.param: True for a 204 response, False for a 404

member.name: T:Octokit.AuthorizationExtensions
member.summary: Represents operations to simplify triggering the authorization flow

member.name: M:Octokit.AuthorizationExtensions.GetOrCreateApplicationAuthentication(Octokit.IAuthorizationsClient,System.String,System.String,Octokit.NewAuthorization,System.Func{Octokit.TwoFactorRequiredException,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Octokit.TwoFactorChallengeResult}})
member.summary: This method will create a new authorization for the specified OAuth application, only if an authorization for that application doesn’t already exist for the user. It returns the user’s token for the application if one exists. Otherwise, it creates a new one.

remarks.para: This method allows the caller to provide a callback which is used to retrieve the two-factor code from the user. Typically the callback is used to show some user interface to the user.
See API documentation for more details.

member.param: Client Id for the OAuth application that is requesting the token
Defines the scopes and metadata for the token
Callback used to retrieve the two-factor authentication code from the user

member.name: M:Octokit.ApiConnection.GetQueuedOperation``1(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a GET to the API object at the specified URI. This operation is appropriate for API calls which queue long running calculations and return a collection of a resource. It expects the API to respond with an initial 202 Accepted, and queries again until a 200 OK is received. It returns an empty collection if it receives a 204 No Content response.
member.typeparam: The API resource's type.
member.param: URI of the API resource to update
A token used to cancel this potentially long running request
member.exception: Thrown when an API error occurs.

member.remarks: See more information regarding User-Agent requirements here: https://developer.github.com/v3/#user-agent-required
member.param: The name (and optionally version) of the product using this library, the name of your GitHub organization, or your GitHub username (in that order of preference). This is sent to the server as part of the user agent for analytics purposes, and used by GitHub to contact you if there are problems.
Provides credentials to the client when making requests

member.name: M:Octokit.Connection.#ctor(Octokit.ProductHeaderValue,System.Uri,Octokit.ICredentialStore)

member.name: M:Octokit.IApiConnection.GetQueuedOperation``1(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a GET to the API object at the specified URI. This operation is appropriate for API calls which queue long running calculations and return a collection of a resource. It expects the API to respond with an initial 202 Accepted, and queries again until a 200 OK is received. It returns an empty collection if it receives a 204 No Content response.
member.typeparam: The API resource's type.
member.param: URI of the API resource to update
A token used to cancel this potentially long running request
member.exception: Thrown when an API error occurs.

member.summary: Maintenance request details to enable/disable maintenance mode immediately
member.param: true to enable, false to disable

members.member:
Maintenance request details to enable/disable maintenance at a specified time (only applicable when enabling maintenance)
true to enable, false to disable A phrase specifying when maintenance mode will be enabled. Phrase uses humanized forms supported by the mojombo/chronic library used by the GitHub API such as "this friday at 5pm" or "5 minutes before midday tomorrow" If enabled is false, the when parameter is ignored and maintenance is turned off immediately

member.name: M:Octokit.UpdateMaintenanceRequestDetails.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Maintenance request details to enable/disable maintenance at a specified time (only applicable when enabling maintenance)
member.param: true to enable, false to disable
A specifying when maintenance mode will be enabled.
member.remarks: If enabled is false, the when parameter is ignored and maintenance is turned off immediately

member.summary: Whether maintenance mode is enabled or disabled

member.name: P:Octokit.UpdateMaintenanceRequestDetails.When
member.summary: When maintenance mode will take effect (only applicable when enabling maintenance)

member.name: T:Octokit.NewMerge
member.summary: Used to merge branches in a repository.

remarks.para: The Repo Merging API supports merging branches in a repository. This accomplishes essentially the same thing as merging one branch into another in a local repository and then pushing to GitHub. The benefit is that the merge is done on the server side and a local repository is not needed. This makes it more appropriate for automation and other tools where maintaining local repositories would be cumbersome and inefficient.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the organization.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string that’s passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the hook to create. Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Config
member.summary: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Events
member.summary: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"]

member.name: P:Octokit.NewOrganizationHook.Active
member.summary: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string that’s passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any true/false values will be converted automatically.
A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the hook to create. Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Config
member.summary: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Events
member.summary: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ["push"]

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryHook.Active
member.summary: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook
member.summary: Creates a Webhook for the repository.
member.remarks:
To create a webhook, the following fields are required by the config:
url A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.
content_type
An optional string defining the media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include json and form. The default is form.
secret
An optional string that’s passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header. The value of this header is computed as the HMAC hex digest of the body, using the secret as the key.
insecure_ssl:
An optional string that determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for url will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include "0" (verification is performed) and "1" (verification is not performed). The default is "0".
API: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook

member.name: M:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Using default values for ContentType, Secret and InsecureSsl.
member.param: Use "web" for a webhook or use the name of a valid service. (See https://api.github.com/hooks for the list of valid service names.)

Key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repository. Booleans are stored internally as “1” for true, and “0” for false. Any true/false values will be converted automatically.
A required string defining the URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL of the hook to create.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content type used to serialize the payload. The default is `form`.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.Secret
member.summary: Gets the secret used as the key for the HMAC hex digest of the body passed with the HTTP requests as an X-Hub-Signature header.

member.name: P:Octokit.NewRepositoryWebHook.InsecureSsl
member.summary: Gets whether the SSL certificate of the host will be verified when delivering payloads. The default is `false`.
member.value: true if SSL certificate verification is not performed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Octokit.NewTag
member.summary: Used to create a new tag
member.remarks: Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then create the refs/tags/[tag] reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to create the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

member.summary: A set of scopes to request. If not provided, scope defaults to an empty list of scopes for users that don’t have a valid token for the app. For users who do already have a valid token for the app, the user won’t be shown the OAuth authorization page with the list of scopes. Instead, this step of the flow will automatically complete with the same scopes that were used last time the user completed the flow.
member.remarks: See the scopes documentation for more information about scopes.

member.summary: Whether or not unauthenticated users will be offered an option to sign up for GitHub during the OAuth flow. The default is true. Use false in the case that a policy prohibits signups.

member.name: T:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate
member.summary: Represents updatable fields on a repository. Values that are null will not be sent in the request. Use string.empty if you want to clear a value.

member.name: M:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an object that describes an update to a repository on GitHub.
member.param: The name of the repository. This is the only required parameter.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Name
member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the repository name.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Description
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the repository description. The default is null (do not update)

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Homepage
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the repository homepage url. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Private
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to make the repository private. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasIssues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable issues for the repository. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasWiki
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether to enable the wiki for the repository. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.HasDownloads
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether to enable downloads for the repository. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.DefaultBranch
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the default branch. The default is null (do not update).

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowRebaseMerge
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Rebase and Merge" method to be used.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowSquashMerge
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Squash Merge" merge method to be used.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.AllowMergeCommit
member.summary: Optional. Allows the "Create a merge commit" merge method to be used.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Archived
member.summary: Optional. True to archive this repository. Note: you cannot unarchive repositories through the API.

member.name: P:Octokit.RepositoryUpdate.Visibility
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets whether the new repository is public, private, or internal. A value provided here overrides any value set in the existing private field.

member.summary: Whether or not the pull request can be merged.

member.summary: Provides extra information regarding the mergeability of the pull request.

member.summary: The user who merged the pull request.

member.name: P:Octokit.PullRequest.MergeCommitSha
member.summary: The value of this field changes depending on the state of the pull request. Not Merged - the hash of the test commit used to determine mergeability. Merged with merge commit - the hash of said merge commit. Merged via squashing - the hash of the squashed commit added to the base branch. Merged via rebase - the hash of the commit that the base branch was updated to.

member.summary: Provides extra information regarding the mergeability of a pull request

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Dirty
member.summary: Merge conflict. Merging is blocked.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Unknown
member.summary: Mergeability was not checked yet. Merging is blocked.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Blocked
member.summary: Failing/missing required status check. Merging is blocked.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Behind
member.summary: Head branch is behind the base branch. Only if required status checks is enabled but loose policy is not. Merging is blocked.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Unstable
member.summary: Failing/pending commit status that is not part of the required status checks. Merging is still allowed.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.HasHooks
member.summary: GitHub Enterprise only, if a repo has custom pre-receive hooks. Merging is allowed.

member.name: F:Octokit.MergeableState.Clean
member.summary: No conflicts, everything good. Merging is allowed.

member.name: T:Octokit.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the data types JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.DeserializeObject(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An IList<object>, a IDictionary<string,object>, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.TryDeserializeObject(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Try parsing the json string into a value.
member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.SerializeObject(System.Object,Octokit.IJsonSerializerStrategy)
member.summary: Converts a IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object> object into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.IsNumeric(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if a given object is numeric in any way (can be integer, double, null, etc).
